subject: Curlin (Race Horse)
Horse Racing
organizations: Woodward Stakes at Saratoga Race Course
lead_paragraph: Curlin, the champion 3-year-old of 2007 and horse of the year, drew the No. 5 post in a field of eight Thursday, and was made the 3-5 morning-line favorite for Saturday’s $500,000 Woodward Stakes at Saratoga Race Course. Curlin, a 4-year-old who is regarded as the world’s best horse on dirt, goes for his sixth victory in a row on that surface in the mile-and-an-eighth Woodward. Of the seven challengers to Curlin, Divine Park is the most accomplished. He drew the No. 4 post.
